home.aboutText: At Petit Plaisir, we are a pastry house with over 20 years of experience creating cakes, cookies, bread, desserts, gelatins, and more. Everything we offer is made with our own recipes, natural ingredients, and the values that define us: dedication, effort, love, and respect in every creation.

home.ctaRebanadaText: At Petit, you can enjoy the Rebanda of your craving¬Æ: choose the flavor and also the size. Just the portion you want, with the flavor of eternity.
home.contactText: We are ready to serve you and sweeten your special moments. Call us, write to us, or visit our store.

about.title: What is now Petit was once a dream filled with faith. Mrs. Alma tells you how Petit went from being a family dream to becoming a home for those who love baking with soul.
about.subtitle1: The history of this bakery began long before it was called Petit. It all started when I was just 7 or 8 years old and my mom sent me to buy bread every afternoon. I loved watching the bakers work: that aroma, that atmosphere... for me, it was magic. When I got home, I would play at imitating what I saw and create my own little cakes. That game, which began out of curiosity, gradually became a real passion: that's how my love of baking was born.
about.subtitle2: Over the years, this hobby took on a new meaning. When my first child turned one, I wanted to celebrate with a special cake. Since I didn't know how to make the decorations I had in mind, I ended up buying it from a well-known bakery. It was pretty, but my family didn't like the taste. We cut the cake, but no one ate it. A few days later, I threw it away, and at that moment, I made a promise to myself: the next birthday would be different; I would make a delicious and special cake for my son myself. And I kept my promise. I studied, practiced, and on that day I made my first cake truly made with love.
about.subtitle3: That spark began to grow. Family and friends started asking me for cakes for their events, all baked and decorated from my kitchen at home.
about.subtitle4: On December 19, 1999, in the midst of a family economic crisis, I made two decisions: to support the household economy and to share joy through my desserts. That's how I opened my first bakery in downtown Tlaquepaque. It was a tiny place that I ran myself, and that's where its name came from: Petit. That day also saw the birth of Pier, our little chef, who has been with us every step of the way.
about.subtitle5: Over time, thanks to the trust of our customers and the efforts of many people who have joined the project, Petit has grown. Today we are still the same family and the same essence, but with new generations, new projects, and a modern production facility. Our image has been revamped, but our heart has not changed.
about.subtitle6: We continue to prepare the same recipes, with the same quality, the same flavor, and above all, the same soul.
about.subtitle7: We are Petit... Pastries with Soul.
about.sliceHeading: Do you want to hear where the magic of Petit began? ‚ú®
about.sliceText: In this audio, Do√±a Alma (the voice that gave life to our flavors) tells us how a little love for the bakery transformed into a sweet dream that now adorns many special moments. Let yourself be carried by its history: How it began, the first pastels made with love, and the path that turned Petit into a bakery that so many take in their hearts. Press play and enter the origin of our magic.
about.slicePoint3: Fresh and made for the day.
